column4: Hey I have been getting this error:  ALWrapper::init(): can't load "libopenal.so.0" library libopenal.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory. But the problem is I have all of the openal packages installed. Any clue?

Hey I have been getting this error:  ALWrapper::init(): can't load "libopenal.so.0" library libopenal.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory. But the problem is I have all of the openal packages installed. Any clue?

Hey I have been getting this error:  ALWrapper::init(): can't load "libopenal.so.0" library libopenal.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory. But the problem is I have all of the openal packages installed. Any clue?
find out where libopen1..l. is the link to where the prog looksfor it.
I am trying out the Unigine Demos and I had them working a while ago and now they don't work. I have already sym linked all of the libopenal.so.0 to libopenal.so.1 and it still doesn't work.
it's not seeing it. Find out why.
Where do I find Unigine's search path at?
tried that. It gave me /usr/lib and /usr/lib64 and both copies of libopenal.so.0 are sym linked to so.1
didn't itt say could not find *.0?
yes. All I have on my sys is *.1 so I symlinked .0 to .1 so it might help.
I'm going to pastebin a copy of the log.html
I have also notice that it complains about not having VBO support, which a couple of other programs have complained about.
but I have a Radeon HD 4870 with the latest fglrx drivers (9.5)
the good book says 'do unto others as others do unto you'
